results.title: Modulation of sympathetic vasoconstriction is critical for the effects of sleep on arterial pressure in mice.
results.text_hl: On passing from N to @<m>DISEASE_REM_Sleep_Parasomnias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020923 @@@rapid-eye-movement@@@ sleep (R), the increase in AP was significantly blunted by @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@prazosin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, whereas the accompanying decrease in HP was blunted by @CHEMICAL_Atropine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001285 @@@atropine@@@ and abolished by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Lo Martire V, Silvani A, Alvente S, Bastianini S, Berteotti C, Valli A, Zoccoli G. Modulation of sympathetic vasoconstriction is critical for the effects of sleep on arterial pressure in mice. J Physiol. 2018 Feb 15;596(4):591-608. PMID: 29266348
